page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: The two railway stations closed in the early sixties.In 1985 public bus services from Penrith ceased. This has left a once weekly service to Kendal(Braithwaites)and a daily bus,Primrose, from Newcastle to Blackpool.The complete closure of the Carlisle to Settle railway line, which has occasional weekend trains is imminent.Private transport is now almost essential. There has been an improvement in the road network. The M6 is 15 minutes away at Tebay on the modernised A685 and the A66 gives good east west links. Coach or "bus traffic" between the north east and Blackpool has decreased in recent years. Public demands for a town car park are frequently voiced. Popular opinion wants it sited in Faraday Rd. A by-pass planned to the west has no definite starting date.
